text: Try  `content_by_ids([ module.blog_id ])` instead, the brackets are not needed when already writing HubL.

So this hubl command doesn’t need to come from the all page or even a blog page or anything like that — is there a use case that you want to have it on that page?

Also what is the reason you’re not using the default pagination? So I just wanna make sure I’m giving you the right info

Hello, I am having issues with the image tag not working in my global header. I am using: `{% image "image" label="Header Image", alt="Header Image", src="../../images/home-illustration@2x.png" %}` but for some reason it is not working or generating an area to edit in global content (see screenshot). I have altered the tag to use image_src which works but that is not the tag I want to use: `{% image_src "image" label="Header Image", alt="Header Image", src="../../images/home-illustration@2x.png" %}` Any help would be much appreciated!!

well the main reason is our client wants to have a separate pagination for the "/all" simple_list_page. 

hmm, we just wanted to render the posts like an infinite scrolling but with a pagination, if that makes sense.

because using the "/all" slug it renders all 200 maximum posts once the page loads, and we wanted to minimize it something like 10 posts to render once the page loads.

Hi everyone, I create a page with a query hubdb_table_rows and my page can still full-prerender. However, when I create a page and config it as a dynamic page, it only returns a two-phase prerender.

I wonder if hubdb_table_rows() support the page to full prerendering but the dynamic (same principle, I think) can not?
I posted a question here, feel free to put your answer
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/HubDB-when-the-page-gets-two-phases-and-full-prerender/m-p/573175#M27301>
